intro: Meibomia ciliaris, commonly known as the threadleaf meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving them a thread-like appearance. Meibomia ciliaris is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
